page.title: 15HILTON GRANGE FARM
page.content: Hilton Grange Farm is owned by the {National Childrens Home}and is on the top of the ridge which divides {Airedale and Wharfedale}.It is a dairy farm and covers 270 acres.Over 200 animals are kept and the milking herd numbers 120.A lorry comes each day at about 2 pm and takes away 1500 litres of milk.The herd are Holsteins and the average{lactation}of the herd is 1400 gallons{.Canadian Holstein Bulls are being used to try to raise the butterfat level which is just under 4% and also to raise the herd's average yield.In the summer the cows are outside but in October they come in and eat silage which is cut from 115 acres of grass-land.Five acres of hay are made for the small calves.The farm is run by a farm manager and two labourers and older pupils from Hilton Grange School.{CHERYL GIBSON.
